subject: Languages
title: 1066: The Conquest That Split English in Two
description: A micro-lesson that makes 1066: The Conquest That Split English in Two usable.

hook.text: One battle changed English forever. In 1066, William the Conqueror invaded from Normandy.

buildup.text: After defeating King Harold at Hastings, French-speaking Normans took over England.

discovery.text: French became the language of royalty, law, and government for nearly 300 years.

twist.text: English peasants still spoke English â€” creating a two-tier language system.

climax.text: 'Cow' is English (the peasant's word), 'beef' is French (the noble's meal). Both survived.

punchline.text: English has two words for everything because two peoples shared one country.

quiz.question: Why does English have 'cow' and 'beef' for the same animal?
options: Peasants used English, nobles used French
